 > Everyone now thinks Balian of Ibelin was a bastard son -- a French 
 > blacksmith -- of Godfrey of Ibelin, and that he bonked and settled
down 
 > with the Queen of Jerusalem. In fact, Balian (the Younger) was the 
 > legitimate son of Balian (the Elder) of Ibelin -- one of three
brothers 
 > -- and was married (quite happily) to the dowager empress of
Byzantium.
 > 
 > (Yes, I'm watching Kingdom of Heaven right now...)
 
Oh dear. I'm yet to watch this but I was looking forward to hiring it
out sometime... so much for that. I'll never understand why writers feel
obliged to change history to fit their vision for a story. If they had
any talent, they'd do it vice-versa.
